Class OtpAuthenticator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.security.verifysdk.OtpAuthenticator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

public class OtpAuthenticator
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • OtpAuthenticator

        public OtpAuthenticator​(@NonNull
                        java.lang.String rawJsonData)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        VerifySdkException
        Creates a new instance by parsing the incoming data.
        Parameters:
        rawJsonData - serialized json representation of an otp authenticator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null.
        VerifySdkException - if the data could not be parsed.

      • OtpAuthenticator

        public OtpAuthenticator​(@NonNull
                        java.lang.String secret,
                        @NonNull
                        java.lang.String issuer,
                        @NonNull
                        java.lang.String accountName,
                        int digits,
                        int period,
                        @NonNull
                        java.lang.String algorithm,
                        int counter,
                        @NonNull
                        OtpAuthenticator.OtpType otpType)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new instance by parsing the incoming data.

        As 'period' and 'counter' are both allowed at the same time, the differentiation on whether it is TOTP or HOTP is defined by the 'otpType' parameter.

        Parameters:
        secret - the OTP shared secret value to be used to seed the OTP algorithm.
        issuer - the name of the service.
        accountName - the account name associated with the service.
        digits - the number of digits in the OTP.
        period - the TOTP time step size.
        algorithm - the name of the preferred algorithm as described in Enum.name().
        counter - the initial value for the HOTP counter.
        otpType - the type of the OTP.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null.

      • getKeyName

        @NonNull
public java.lang.String getKeyName​(@NonNull
                                   SubType subType)
        Description copied from interface: IAuthenticator
        Returns the keyName for the given SubType.

        The key name is the identifier of the authenticator (from IAuthenticator.getIdentifier(), concatenated with the string representation of the sub type.

        Specified by:
        getKeyName in interface IAuthenticator
        Parameters:
        subType - the sub type of the requested key name
        Returns:
        if sub type is not null - the name of the key
        otherwise - an empty string
